alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 11:40AM MDT until August 12 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Taos. In northeast New Mexico, Colfax and Mora. * WHEN...Until 245 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms near Tres Ritos and Angel Fire. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Angel Fire, Vietnam Veterans Memorial State Park and Tres Ritos. - This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 47 and 52. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 267 and 279. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 29 and 36. This includes the following recreation areas... Agua Piedra Campground, Duran Canyon Campground, Upper La Junta Campground, Angel Fire Ski Area, Flechado Picnic Area and Vietnam Veterans Memorial State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
